title: Confusing diagnostics when using associated const as an array size

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
```rust
trait Adapter {
    const LINKS: usize;
}

struct Foo<A: Adapter> {
    adapter: A,
    links: [u32; A::LINKS],
}
```
[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=39e7693cf8a87f30e40a4d280c312e6a)
```
error[E0599]: no associated item named `LINKS` found for type `A` in the current scope
 --> src/lib.rs:7:21
  |
7 |     links: [u32; A::LINKS],
  |                     ^^^^^ associated item not found in `A`
  |
  = help: items from traits can only be used if the type parameter is bounded by the trait
help: the following trait defines an item `LINKS`, perhaps you need to restrict type parameter `A` with it:
  |
5 | struct Foo<A: Adapter + Adapter> {
  |            ^^^^^^^^^^^^
```



At the same time on nightly with `#![feature(const_generics)]` error description is much better:
```rust
#![feature(const_generics)]
trait Adapter {
    const LINKS: usize;
}

struct Foo<A: Adapter> {
    adapter: A,
    links: [u32; A::LINKS],
}
```
[Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=5af78935c897d1c7c5395ac820a03ae8)

```
error: constant expression depends on a generic parameter
 --> src/lib.rs:8:5
  |
8 |     links: [u32; A::LINKS],
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: this may fail depending on what value the parameter takes
```
